intro: Peucedanum leiocarpum, commonly known as the Chinese cowparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to China and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant produces oval, green fruits that mature to a yellowish-brown color. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Peucedanum leiocarpum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
